Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizing an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Washington, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption (in addition to the homestead exemption authorized under the provisions of Article VII, Section 20 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended (the "Louisiana Constitution"), which applies to the first $7,500 of the assessed valuation of property), be authorized on the next $7,500 of assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption, with respect to property owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of 100% by the United States Department of Veteran Affairs, and their surviving spouse, on property located in the Parish of Washington, State of Louisiana, in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses shall extend and apply to property in the Parish of Washington, State of Louisiana only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of the Parish of Washington, State of Louisiana voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bogalusa -- 5 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bogalusa Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a five (5) mill ad valorem tax for a period of ten (10) years for the purpose of paying the costs of constructing, acquiring, improving, maintaining and/or operating landfill facilities for the City, including the acquisition of land therefor.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 27(B) of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a five (5) mill ad valorem tax (an estimated $315,176.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021 for the purpose of paying the costs of constructing, acquiring, improving, maintaining and/or operating landfill facilities for the City, including the acquisition of land therefor; and shall the City be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds from time to time for any of said capital improvements, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana, including Sub Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. #5 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 5 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 10 mills tax renewal for maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities, purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and services, and for the added purposes of purchase of real estate, buildings, and/or construction of a fire station or fire stations for Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 5.
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 5, State of Louisiana, (the "District"), continue to levy a ten (10) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $455,700 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities, purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and services, and for the added purposes of purchase of real estate, buildings, and/or construction of a fire station or fire stations for Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 5, State of Louisiana? Said special tax renewal shall be subject to homestead exemption.

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. #6 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District Number 6 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 10 mills tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating facilities and equipment to provide fire protection and emergency medical services, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District Number 6, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $76,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating facilities and equipment to provide fire protection and emergency medical services, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of the levy and collection of a 13.0 mills property tax within the Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7, State of Louisiana, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2013, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2022, for the purpose of providing funds to be used by the Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7 to acquire, construct, improve, maintain and/or operate facilities and equipment to provide fire protection and emergency medical services in and for the Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7, including the purchase of fire trucks and other fire fighting and emergency equipment, and to pay the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including hydrant rentals and service.
Race.FullText: Shall the Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended, La. R.S. 40:1501(A), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to renew the levy and collection of, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of 13.0 mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $525,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire year), beginning with the tax collection for the year 2013, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2022, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used by the District to acquire, construct, improve, maintain and/or operate facilities and equipment to provide fire protection and emergency medical services in and for the Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7, including the purchase of fire trucks and other fire fighting and emergency equipment, and to pay the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including hydrant rentals and service?
